message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.NA 

The paper deals with the problem of unmixing matrices from their additive mixtures, which is a problem in signal processing and machine learning. The paper also compares the proposed method with the well-known independent component analysis (ICA) method. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the mathematical foundations of signal processing and communication. The paper also involves machine learning algorithms, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also applies the proposed method to image and speech unmixing, which falls under cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.SI (Sound and Image Processing), respectively. Finally, the paper involves computational experiments, which makes cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) another possible sub-category.
